tool.command: #set history_name = $input.history.name #for joa in $input.creating_job_associations: #if $joa.dataset_id == $input.dataset_id: #set job_output_assoc = $joa #end if #end for #set job = $job_output_assoc.job #set tool_id = $job.tool_id #set tool_parameters = "" #for p in $job.parameters: #set tool_parameters = $tool_parameters + "__SeP__" + $p.name #set tool_parameters = $tool_parameters + "__SeP__" + $p.value #end for python $__tool_directory__/bam_to_scidx_output_stats.py --config_file $__tool_directory__/stats_config.ini --input "$input" --input_id "$__app__.security.encode_id($input.id)" --input_datatype "$input.ext" --dbkey "$input.metadata.dbkey" --chrom_len_file ${chromInfo} --history_name "$history_name" --tool_id "$tool_id" --tool_parameters "$tool_parameters" --output "$output"
tool.help:
**What it does**
Generates statistics on the output of the **Convert BAM to ScIdx** tool in the **CEGR Galaxy ChIP-exo** pipeline. These statistics include the genome coverage, which is determined using the following calculation.
- number of lines in input dataset / genome size = genome coverage
A JSON dictionary containing the run, sample and genome reference, along with the above statistics is sent via a POST to the PEGR REST API where the information is stored to support the CEGR ChIP-exo statistics reports.
